New IDI Platform has Launched!
We are excited to announce the completed launch of the new IDI Platform! You will receive an email inviting you to claim your IDI Platform account. If you do not receive that email, please let us know.
Your respondents are also able to claim their IDI accounts. Please visit our Help Center for information on how to complete that process.

subject: REMINDER: IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Today
body:
With the new IDI Platform coming, the current IDI Assessment Website will be offline for migration.

IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Today
 
Reminder:  IDI Qualified Administrators (QAs) will receive an email to claim your IDI QA account. Please use the email address associated with your IDI account to log into the new IDI Platform on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
. 
 
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting today,
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025 at approximately 3:00pm EST
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the new Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by clicking the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password. 
Sign Up for the IDI Help Center
Your login credentials for the IDI Help Center are 
separate
 from the new IDI Platform. 
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
View email in browser

You are receiving this email because you are listed within the IDI, LLC database as an IDI Qualified Administrator or are attending an upcoming IDI Qualifying Seminar. These are only meant for important updates, so please do not unsubscribe. 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe

IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Soon
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting next
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the newe Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by click at the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password.

separate
 from the new IDI Platform.

IDI Platform Launches February 17th
We are excited to announce the new IDI Platform will be launching on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
The current IDI Assessment Website will be 
unavailable
 starting 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
. During the migration period, from February 12th-16th, you will not be able to access your IDI account or data. In addition, respondents will not be able to access the IDI Assessment during that time.
Your IDI data will be migrated to the new Platform and available in your account. If you would like any IDI results in the current report format, you should generate and download those reports no later than 
Tuesday, February 11, 2025
. After the launch, you will be able to generate and download IDI data in the new report format. You can see an example of the new IDI Profile Reports and Intercultural Development Plans (IDP) in your current QA Account under 
QA Resources - New IDI Platform Resources
.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com

subject: IDI Platform Launch Moved to January
body:
The new IDI Platform's launch has been delayed.
 
IDI Platform Releasing January
Due to an unforeseen delay in the last few days of final testing, we are forced to push back the launch of the IDI Platform to early January. An exact date will be announced soon. It is incredibly important to us that the new IDI Platform launches smoothly and can be a positive experience for all QAs. We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding with this update.
The current IDI Assessment Website will continue to operate as normal, allowing you to proceed with your IDI projects without interruption.
 
Today, we are adding more resources in your QA Resources account under 
New IDI Platform Resources
 to help you prepare.
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Timothy,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session on December 10th with Chuck Adams. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:00am CST. I sent a calendar invite with the Zoom link (copied below). Please let me know if you have any questions. 
Zoom Link:  
https://languageandculture.zoom.us/my/chuckadams
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.      When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.      What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.      What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: New IDI Platform Launch Date: December 23
body:
The new IDI Platform is launching on December 23rd!
 
IDI Platform Launches December 23rd
We are excited to announce the new IDI Platform will be launching on Monday, December 23, 2024.
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting Friday, December 20, 2024.
Ahead of the new IDI Platform’s launch, we are asking all QAs to log into their IDI accounts to verify that their account information is accurate. When the accounts are migrated, it will be crucial that your account is up-to-date, especially with email addresses.

subject: IDI Platform Launch Delayed
body:
The new IDI Platform's launch has been delayed.
 
IDI Platform Launch Delayed
Due to an unforeseen delay in the development process, we have decided to postpone the launch of the IDI Platform. We are dedicated to delivering a complete platform that enhances the experience for you and your respondents. We anticipate the Platform will launch before the end of 2024 and will provide a new timeline as soon as we have more information.
In the meantime, the current IDI Assessment Website will continue to function as it has been, allowing you to proceed with your IDI projects without interruption. We understand that this delay may impact your planning, and we sincerely appreciate your understanding and patience during this time.
Resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your QA Resources account under

subject: Upcoming Webinar Cancelled
body:
The upcoming IDI Platform Preview Webinar (October 29, 2024) has been cancelled.
 
IDI Platform Preview Webinar Cancelled
Due to ongoing development, we are cancelling next week’s IDI Platform Preview Webinar. We will instead release short videos dedicated to showing key processes in the new IDI Platform. These short videos will cover the most common processes a QA completes in their IDI account, including ordering, viewing IDI Reports, and creating Report Groups of multiple respondents.
The videos will be released next week and announced via email. Additionally, they will be available on the QA Resources page.
We will keep our IDI Platform Q&A sessions as currently scheduled so we can answer any questions you have before and after launch.
We understand that this change may disrupt your schedule, and we apologize for any inconvenience. However, we believe that these focused videos will provide a more effective and efficient way to learn about the new IDI Platform. We appreciate your understanding and patience as we continue to enhance the QA experience!

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Timothy,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete.
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LCWComp127
 
Password:
 C7EZXRQG
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact us at 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your results.
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Fw: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hi Peggy. Please see Daniel's login credentials in the email below. 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW
Sent:
 Tuesday, July 23, 2024 1:53 PM
To:
 djoyce@linklogistics.com <djoyce@linklogistics.com>
Subject:
 Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
 
Hello Daniel,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it. You are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25th.
 
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics21
 
Password:
 54S88H57
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Daniel,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it. You are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25th.
 
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics21
 
Password:
 54S88H57
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

All the best,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

 Monday, July 22, 2024 1:02:16 PM
To:
 Sam Stockdale <sstockdale@linklogistics.com>
Subject:
 RSVP 7/22 11:59pm PST
 
 
[EXTERNAL EMAIL]
Hi Samuel,
 
I hope you are well. 
 
This is a friendly reminder to complete the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) assessment 
by the end of the day 7/22/2024
. Please, see your IDI Invitation below. It contains your unique and confidential login credentials as well as your IDI PreRead document (attached). 
  
Please, let me know if you have any questions or concerns. 
  
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, July 10, 2024 10:17 AM
To:
 sstockdale@linklogistics.com <sstockdale@linklogistics.com>
Subject:
 Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory 
 
Hello Samuel,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
by July 16
th
 
 as  you are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25
th.
 
.
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics12
 
Password:
 SDC25NPG
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Hi Samuel,

This is a friendly reminder to complete the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) assessment 
by the end of the day 7/22/2024
. Please, see your IDI Invitation below. It contains your unique and confidential login credentials as well as your IDI PreRead document (attached).

From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, July 10, 2024 10:17 AM
To:
 sstockdale@linklogistics.com <sstockdale@linklogistics.com>
Subject:
 Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory 
 
Hello Samuel,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
by July 16
th
 
 as  you are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25
th.
 
.
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics12
 
Password:
 SDC25NPG
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler

Hello Emily,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 7/17/24, with Patricia Coleman.
 
By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:00am CST. 
 
 
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
 
 
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
 
 
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:
  
 
 
 
1.      When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.      What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.      What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?
  
 
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler
IDI Administrator

Subject:
 Emily July 18 12pm CST IDI Profile and Plan/Debrief with Patricia Coleman
 
 
Dear Emily,
 
This is Patricia, your IDI Q.A assigned coach.
 
I am sorry I missed you yesterday 07/17 for your IDI profile debrief but got the message that you were delayed. 
 
Kaitlin rescheduled for today 07/18 @12pm CST and ZOOM room is open at least 5mn early.
 
Ou relationship with BSC is important and your time is very valuable.
 
As we all work from different time zones ( I am in FL/EST), I am inviting you to reschedule keeping me in copy so that one of us respond to better serve your schedule.
 
I have to sign off unfortunately as it is 12:22pm EST and we need 45mn to 1hr for the debrief.
 
Looking forward to hearing from you,
 
Respectfully,

subject: Fw: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory
body:
Hi Sonya,
 
I hope you are well. 
 
This is a friendly reminder to complete the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) assessment. The group report must be prepared by Monday July 19th for our Group Debrief on July 25th. Feel free to use the weekend, if needed, to complete the assessment.
 
Please, see your IDI Invitation below. It contains your unique and confidential login credentials as well as your IDI PreRead document (attached). 
  
Please, let me know if you have any questions or concerns. 
  
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, July 10, 2024 10:17 AM
To:
 shuffman@linklogistics.com <shuffman@linklogistics.com>
Subject:
 Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory 
 
Hello Sonya,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
by July 16
th
 
 as  you are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25
th.
 
.
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
by July 16
th
 
 as  you are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25
th.
 
.
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics10
 
Password:
 65DLUA2X
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, July 16, 2024 2:19 PM
To:
 Colletti, Emily (she/her/hers) <Emily.Colletti@bsci.com>
Subject:
 {External} Your IDI Profile and Plan
 
 
CAUTION
: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. Be Security Conscious! 
 
Hello Emily,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 7/17/24, with Patricia Coleman.
 
By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:00am CST. 
 
 
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
 
 
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
 
 
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:
  
 
 
 
1.      When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.      What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.      What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?
  
 
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler
IDI Administrator
 
 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

body:
Hello Russell,
 
I hope you are well.
 
I received a request to resend your IDI Invitation. Please, see it below. It contains your unique and confidential login credentials as well as your IDI PreRead document (attached).
 
Please, let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler
IDI Administrator
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, July 10, 2024 10:17 AM
To:
 rpeskin@linklogistics.com <rpeskin@linklogistics.com>
Subject:
 Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory
 
 
Hello Russell,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
by July 16
th
 
 as  you are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25
th.
 
.
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics13
 
Password:
 SY8SMELG
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Sent:
 Tuesday, July 16, 2024 2:19 PM
To:
 Colletti, Emily (she/her/hers) <Emily.Colletti@bsci.com>
Subject:
 {External} Your IDI Profile and Plan
 
 
CAUTION
: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. Be Security Conscious! 
 
Hello Emily,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 7/17/24, with Patricia Coleman.
 
By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:00am CST. 
 
 
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
 
 
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
 
 
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:
  
 
 
 
1.      When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.      What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.      What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?
  
 
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler
IDI Administrator
 
 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator

k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory
body:
Hello Tara,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
by July 16
th
 
 as  you are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25
th.
 
.
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics1
 
Password:
 HBRPQX5K
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Emily,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 6/7/24, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 9:00am CDT. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.      When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.      What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.      What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Matt,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 5/17/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 12:00pm CST. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Cory,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 5/10/2024, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:00am CST. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Gretchen,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session today, 5/7/24, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 1:00pm CST. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Subject:
 {External} Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
 
CAUTION
: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. Be Security Conscious! 
 
Hello Gretchen,
As Ken McKee shared with you, Boston Scientific is partnering with LCW to deliver an Inclusive Leadership workshop. To prepare for the workshop, you are invited to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in an individual debrief to discuss your results.  During the workshop, you will have the opportunity to participate in a group discussion of the group IDI results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
before May 3rd
.
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-BSCMapleGrove14
 
Password:
 CAFHU2BN
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact us at 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your results 
by May 10
th
.
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Ken,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session Monday, 5/6/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 2:30pm CST. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

 Stofferahn, Gretchen <Gretchen.Stofferahn@bsci.com>; Ehle, Troy (he/him/his) <troy.ehle@bsci.com>; Treichel, Brett (he/him/his) <Brett.Treichel@bsci.com>; Chouanard, Kevin <Kevin.Chouanard@bsci.com>; Colletti, Emily (she/her/hers) <Emily.Colletti@bsci.com>
Cc:
 McKee, Kenneth (he/him/his) <Kenneth.McKee@bsci.com>
Subject:
 Reminder to Complete Your IDI Assessment by Friday, May 3
 
Hello Maple Grove Leaders,  
 
I hope this email finds you well. This is a gentle reminder to complete your Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) by this 
Friday, May 3.
 The assessment will take 20-30 minutes to complete. This is an input for the May 31 leadership workshop, where we will spend some time reviewing overall group results. 
 
Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your individual results during a debrief session with a Qualified IDI Administration by May 10th.
 
Please do not hesitate to reach out with any questions. Thank you. 
 
Kind regards,
 
Hollina Ung
Principal DE&I Consultant
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
She / Her / Hers
Chicago, IL 
hollina.ung@bsci.com
www.bostonscientific.com

 Stofferahn, Gretchen <Gretchen.Stofferahn@bsci.com>; Ehle, Troy (he/him/his) <troy.ehle@bsci.com>; Treichel, Brett (he/him/his) <Brett.Treichel@bsci.com>; Chouanard, Kevin <Kevin.Chouanard@bsci.com>; Colletti, Emily (she/her/hers) <Emily.Colletti@bsci.com>
Cc:
 McKee, Kenneth (he/him/his) <Kenneth.McKee@bsci.com>
Subject:
 Reminder to Complete Your IDI Assessment by Friday, May 3
 
Hello Maple Grove Leaders,  
 
I hope this email finds you well. This is a gentle reminder to complete your Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) by this 
Friday, May 3.
 The assessment will take 20-30 minutes to complete. This is an input for the May 31 leadership workshop, where we will spend some time reviewing overall group results. 
 
Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your individual results during a debrief session with a Qualified IDI Administration by May 10th.
 
Please do not hesitate to reach out with any questions. Thank you. 
 
Kind regards,
 
Hollina Ung
Principal DE&I Consultant
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
She / Her / Hers
Chicago, IL 
hollina.ung@bsci.com
www.bostonscientific.com

Kaitlin Nonweiler

From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, April 17, 2024 11:49 AM
To:
 brian.hargraves@bsci.com <brian.hargraves@bsci.com>
Subject:
 Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
 
Hello Brian,
As Ken McKee shared with you, Boston Scientific is partnering with LCW to deliver an Inclusive Leadership workshop. To prepare for the workshop, you are invited to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in an individual debrief to discuss your results.  During the workshop, you will have the opportunity to participate in a group discussion of the group IDI results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
before May 3rd
.
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-BSCMapleGrove2
 
Password:
 852EXAE3
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact us at 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your results 
by May 10
th
.
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

As Ken McKee shared with you, Boston Scientific is partnering with LCW to deliver an Inclusive Leadership workshop. before May 3rd
.

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Jennifer,
As Ken McKee shared with you, Boston Scientific is partnering with LCW to deliver an Inclusive Leadership workshop. To prepare for the workshop, you are invited to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in an individual debrief to discuss your results.  During the workshop, you will have the opportunity to participate in a group discussion of the group IDI results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
before May 3rd
.
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.

To complete the assessment, please login at:

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Renee,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 4/18/24, with Andrea Wicks Bowles. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 3:00pm. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

As a reminder, your debrief starts at 9:00am EST. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. In preparation for your debrief

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Paul,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 2/22/2024, with Patricia Coleman. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 1:30pm ET. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Fw: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Karthikeyini,
I hope you are doing well. Please see the email below and the attachments for your IDI debrief tomorrow, 2/9/24, with Larry Baker. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 4:00pm ET. Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns. 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW
Sent:
 Wednesday, January 24, 2024 10:55 AM
To:
 Karthikeyini.Subramanian@ll.mit.edu <Karthikeyini.Subramanian@ll.mit.edu>
Subject:
 Your IDI Profile and Plan
 
 
Hello Karthikeyini, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/25/24, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:30am ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Hello Emily,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session Monday, 2/5/24, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 2:30pm ET. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler

To:
 Davies, Jeremy <
Jeremy.Davies@lendlease.com
>
Subject:
 [EXT]:Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
Hello Jeremy, 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your results. The IDI® is highly accurate and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
as soon as possible (preferably by October 23
rd
) so that you can receive your 30-minute Individual IDI Debrief prior to the in-person Group Debrief on November 1st.
 
Please note that your Individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
 
1)          
Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your own individual profile. 
2)          
When completing the IDI, please respond to the questions with your own independent opinions/responses. Do not respond to them based on how you think others might view or judge your behaviors, opinions, or attitudes. In other words, the assessment needs to know what you believe about yourself. 
3)          
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
 
4)          
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
Username:
 2355-Lendlease13
Password:
 
5)      It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
6)      In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
7)    Once you have completed the Assessment, please, send an email to 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule your 1:1 IDI Debrief.
Thank you,
 
Conner Williams, ACC, CPCC
(he/him/his)
Consultant
LCW

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Joanna,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 2/1/24, with Chuck Adams. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 1:00pm ET. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

 Asha.Rajagopal@ll.mit.edu <Asha.Rajagopal@ll.mit.edu>
Subject:
 Your IDI Profile and Plan
 
 
Hello Asha,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/31/24, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 5:00pm ET. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

 Davies, Jeremy <
Jeremy.Davies@lendlease.com
>
Subject:
 [EXT]:Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
Hello Jeremy, 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your results. The IDI® is highly accurate and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
as soon as possible (preferably by October 23
rd
) so that you can receive your 30-minute Individual IDI Debrief prior to the in-person Group Debrief on November 1st.
 
Please note that your Individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
 
1)          
Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your own individual profile. 
2)          
When completing the IDI, please respond to the questions with your own independent opinions/responses. Do not respond to them based on how you think others might view or judge your behaviors, opinions, or attitudes. In other words, the assessment needs to know what you believe about yourself. 
3)          
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
 
4)          
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
Username:
 2355-Lendlease13
Password:
 
5)      It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
6)      In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
7)    Once you have completed the Assessment, please, send an email to 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule your 1:1 IDI Debrief.
Thank you,
 
Conner Williams, ACC, CPCC
(he/him/his)
Consultant
LCW

Subject:
 [EXT]:Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
Hello Jeremy, 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your results. The IDI® is highly accurate and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
as soon as possible (preferably by October 23
rd
) so that you can receive your 30-minute Individual IDI Debrief prior to the in-person Group Debrief on November 1st.
 
Please note that your Individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
 
1)          
Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your own individual profile. 
2)          
When completing the IDI, please respond to the questions with your own independent opinions/responses. Do not respond to them based on how you think others might view or judge your behaviors, opinions, or attitudes. In other words, the assessment needs to know what you believe about yourself. 
3)          
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
 
4)          
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
Username:
 2355-Lendlease13
Password:
 
5)      It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
6)      In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
7)    Once you have completed the Assessment, please, send an email to 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule your 1:1 IDI Debrief.
Thank you,
 
Conner Williams, ACC, CPCC
(he/him/his)

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Charlotte, 
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/30/24, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:00am ET. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
