subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello JJ,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session Monday, 1/29/24, with Tamara  Thorpe. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 12:30pm PT. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

As a reminder, your debrief starts at 10:00am ET. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Carey, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/24/2024, with Chuck Adams. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 1:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
IDI Administrator 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Douglas, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/23/2024, with Chuck Adams. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:00am MT.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Hello Roberto, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/17/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:30am ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Hello Roberto, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/17/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:30am ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Good morning team,
 
Hope all is well. I had to reschedule my original debrief session and proceeded to select a different day/time.
 
Unfortunately, I just received a cancellation and was hoping to schedule the IDI debrief. Completing the session before our team’s onsite meeting on Wed, 01/24 would be great!

From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, January 16, 2024 4:24 PM
To:
 Martinez, Roberto - 1300 - MITLL <Roberto.Martinez@ll.mit.edu>
Subject:
 [EXT] Your IDI Profile and Plan
 
Hello Roberto, Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/17/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which 
ZjQcmQRYFpfptBannerStart
This Message Is From an External Sender 
This message came from outside the Laboratory. 
ZjQcmQRYFpfptBannerEnd
Hello Roberto, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/17/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:30am ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

 Friday, December 22, 2023 12:27 PM
To:
 Maggie Barlow (Parker) <
mbarlow@hcg.com
>
Subject:
 [External] Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
CAUTION: This email originated from an external system. Do not click links, open attachments or forward unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
 
Hello Maggie, 
 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
as soon as possible
. 
 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth. 
 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
 
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile. 
 
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section. 
 
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
 
Username:
  2355-HuronConsultingGroup30
  
Password:
  AY7FHVFV
  
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.     
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to. 
 
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact us at 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your results. 
 
Thank you, 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

body:
Hello Maggie, 
  
I hope you are well. 
  
Thank you for reaching out. The next step is to schedule your 1:1 Debrief session with an LCW Facilitator. Could you please send over some 1- hour timeslots in the next week or so that you are available for this debrief session? 
Please, include your time zone.

Please, let me know if you have any questions or concerns. 
  
Thank you, 
Kaitlin Nonweiler

k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
From:
 Maggie Barlow (Parker) <mbarlow@hcg.com>
Sent:
 Friday, January 12, 2024 11:54 AM
To:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
 
Hi, 
 
I have completed my assessment and looking to schedule the follow-up appointment.
 
Thanks,
Maggie 
 
Maggie Barlow (Parker)
, MHA
Managing Director
Mobile 503-351-2100
mbarlow@hcg.com
www.huronconsultinggroup.com
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, December 22, 2023 12:27 PM
To:
 Maggie Barlow (Parker) <mbarlow@hcg.com>
Subject:
 [External] Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
CAUTION: This email originated from an external system. Do not click links, open attachments or forward unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
 
Hello Maggie, 
 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
as soon as possible
. 
 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth. 
 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
 
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile. 
 
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section. 
 
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
 
Username:
  2355-HuronConsultingGroup30
  
Password:
  AY7FHVFV
  
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.     
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to. 
 
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact us at 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your results. 
 
Thank you, 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
 
DISCLAIMER:
The information transmitted in this e-mail message and attachments, if any, may be attorney-client information, including privileged and confidential matter, and is intended only for the use of the individual or entity named above. Distribution to, or review by, unauthorized persons is strictly prohibited. All personal messages express views solely of the sender, which are not to be attributed to any organization. If you have received this transmission in error, immediately notify the sender and permanently delete this transmission including attachments.

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Larry, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/18/24, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:30am MT.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: RE: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
You don't often get email from bgrill@hcg.com. 
Learn why this is important
My meeting time was moved to 3 PM MST.  Is that the time you have in your records? 
 
Brenda Grill
Mobile 541-740-5825
bgrill@hcg.com
www.huronconsultinggroup.com
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, January 16, 2024 2:38 PM
To:
 Brenda Grill <bgrill@hcg.com>
Subject:
 [External] Your IDI Profile and Plan
 
CAUTION: This email originated from an external system. Do not click links, open attachments or forward unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
 
Hello Brenda, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/17/24, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 10:00am MT.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
 
DISCLAIMER:
The information transmitted in this e-mail message and attachments, if any, may be attorney-client information, including privileged and confidential matter, and is intended only for the use of the individual or entity named above. Distribution to, or review by, unauthorized persons is strictly prohibited. All personal messages express views solely of the sender, which are not to be attributed to any organization. If you have received this transmission in error, immediately notify the sender and permanently delete this transmission including attachments.

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Vanessa, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/16/2024, with Tamara Thorpe. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 5:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Kevin, 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
as soon as possible
. 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth. 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
 
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile. 
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section. 
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
Username:
  
2355-MITLL311
  
Password:
  
YRZ5GU37
  
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.     
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to. 
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please use the link below to schedule your individual debrief with an LCW facilitator. 
https://calendly.com/mit-ll-idi-debriefs/mit-idi-debrief
MIT IDI Debrief - MIT LL IDI Debriefs
calendly.com
Thank you, 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Trevor, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/12/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 3:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Michael, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/11/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 4:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Kelly,  
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/9/24, with Tamara Thorpe. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 12:30 CT/ 1:30pm ET.
 
 
 
 
 
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence. 
 
 
 
 
 
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of 
your
 debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after 
your
 debrief session. 
 
 
 
 
 
In preparation for 
your
 debrief
 
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:  
 
 
 
 
 
1.
      
When you took the 
assessment
 you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are? 
 
 
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?
 
 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?  
 
 
 
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email:
 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Roberto, 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
as soon as possible
.
 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
 
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
 
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
 
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
Username:
 
 
2355-MITLL382
 
 
Password:
 
 
ZNMBDWFN
  
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
 
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please use the Calendly link below to schedule your individual debrief to receive your results. 
https://calendly.com/mit-ll-idi-debriefs/mit-idi-debrief
Thank you, 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email:
 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Hello Vanessa, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/2/2024, with Tamara Thorpe. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 1:00pm ET. 
 
  
 
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
 
  
 
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
 
  
 
In preparation for your debrief
 
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
 
  
 
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
 
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
 
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Hello Evan, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 1/2/2024, with Sarah Nodarse. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 10:30am ET. 
 
  
 
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
 
  
 
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
 
  
 
In preparation for your debrief
 
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
 
  
 
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
 
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
 
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Carey, 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it 
as soon as possible
. 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth. 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
 
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile. 
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section. 
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
Username:
  2355-HuronConsultingGroup26
  
Password:
  
WSCCTTCH
  
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.     
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to. 
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact us at 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your results. 
Thank you, 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Subject:
 #External Email#Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
You don't often get email from 
idi@lcwmail.com
. 
Learn why this is important
Hello Daniel,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it today, 
December 1st
.
After completing the IDI assessment, the next step is to schedule your IDI debrief to receive your individual results (instructions below). 
S
chedule your debrief as soon as possible, all debriefs should be completed by December 22
nd
.
 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
  
2355-WMC5
Password:
 VH5KS383
4) It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5)
 In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
Scheduling Your Individual Debrief:
1) Once you have completed the assessment, the next step is to meet with an LCW Coach for your 1-hour Individual Debrief session. Your Coach for this will be Tamara Thorpe, and you can schedule your session using the following link: 
https://calendly.com/wmc-4/wmc-idi-debrief
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

WMCHealth is operating under a heightened CYBER SECURITY THREAT LEVEL.
 Do not click on links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender. Never provide your User ID or Password.

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Michele, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/22/23, with Tamara Thorpe. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 1:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Lisa, 
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete.
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth. 
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:  
                 
 
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile. 
2) To complete the assessment, please login at:
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section. 
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
 
Username:
  2355-LCWComp122
  
Password:
  
ADX62T5R
  
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.     
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to. 
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact us at 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your results. 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello David, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/20/23, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 4:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Tom, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/20/23, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 2:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Learn why this is important
Hi – if possible and not too late, I’d like to schedule a debrief session.  After Thursday of this week, I wil be out until January 3, so if no time slots are available this week I’d like to set something up for the first week in January if possible.  I’m fairly flexible that week.  
 
Thanks very much!

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Rosemary, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/19/23, with Tamara Thorpe. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 5:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Sandeep, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/19/23, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:30pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Fw: Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Dr. Bierman, 
  
I hope you are well. 
  
Matilde Roman has asked me to resend your IDI Invitation. Please, see it below. It contains your unique and confidential login credentials as well as your IDI PreRead document (attached). 
  
Please, let me know if you have any questions or concerns. 
  
Thank you, 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Friday, December 1, 2023 9:22 AM
To:
 Fredrick.Bierman@wmchealth.org <Fredrick.Bierman@wmchealth.org>
Subject:
 Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
 
Hello Fredrick,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it today, 
December 1st
.
After completing the IDI assessment, the next step is to schedule your IDI debrief to receive your individual results (instructions below). 
S
chedule your debrief as soon as possible, all debriefs should be completed by December 22
nd
.
 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
  
2355-WMC10
Password:
 JJ2GHUGT
4) It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5)
 In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
Scheduling Your Individual Debrief:
1) Once you have completed the assessment, the next step is to meet with an LCW Coach for your 1-hour Individual Debrief session. Your Coach for this will be Tamara Thorpe, and you can schedule your session using the following link: 
https://calendly.com/wmc-4/wmc-idi-debrief
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Brian, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session on Monday, 12/18/23, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 5:00 pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day-to-day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Ken, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/15/23, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 3:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Kathryn, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/13/23, with Tamara Thorpe. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 6:00pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
IDI Administrator 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/12/23, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 10:00am ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator

k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Vanessa, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/7/23, with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 9:00am CT.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day-to-day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.

Kaitlin Nonweiler

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Sandeep, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/6/2023 with Larry Baker. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 12:30pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Lenny,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to 
complete it by December 18th
. Your group debrief date is January 26, 2024. 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your group’s aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 
 
2355-MITLL309
 
Password:
 
 
AW8S6R5G
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please schedule your individual debrief at the following link: 
https://calendly.com/mit-ll-idi-debriefs/mit-idi-debrief
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)

Hello Will,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to 
complete it by December 18th
. Your group debrief date is January 26, 2024. 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your group’s aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Bart,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to 
complete it by December 18th
. Your group debrief date is January 12, 2024. 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) 
Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 
 
2355-MITLL370
 
Password:
 
 
P2CD27KQ
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please schedule your individual debrief at the following link: 
https://calendly.com/mit-ll-idi-debriefs/mit-idi-debrief
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)

k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Nicholas,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to 
complete it by December 18th
. Your group debrief date is January 12, 2024. 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please schedule your individual debrief at the following link: 
https://calendly.com/mit-ll-idi-debriefs/mit-idi-debrief
Thank you,

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Karthi,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results and an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to 
complete it by December 18th
. Your group debrief date is January 10, 2024. 
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else.  Your groups aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) 
To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Craig, 
  
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow, 12/5/23, with Tamara Thorpe. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 4:30pm ET.  
   
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.   
   
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.   
   
In preparation for your debrief
  
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:    
   
1.
      
When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?   
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?  
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?    
  
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you! 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
